Class LoginViewController

java.lang.Object
com.example.theaterproject.Controllers.LoginViewController
public class LoginViewController extends Object
The LoginViewController class is responsible for managing the login interface and facilitating user authentication in the application.

This class handles user actions such as signing in and creating a new account while managing the transition to different views based on the user's role. It interacts with the AccountService to validate credentials.

  • Field Details

    • aUsernameTextField

      private javafx.scene.control.TextField aUsernameTextField
      Represents a text field in the login view for user input of the username. This field is linked to the FXML file associated with the LoginViewController and is used to capture the username input provided by the user.

    • aPasswordField

      private javafx.scene.control.PasswordField aPasswordField
      Represents the password input field on the login view. This field is used to capture the user's password during the authentication process. The password entered in this field is sent to the authentication logic when the user clicks the "Sign In" button. This field is part of the FXML file associated with the LoginViewController class, and it is annotated with @FXML to indicate that it is injected at runtime during FXML loading.

    • aAccountService

      AccountService aAccountService

    • aUIService

      private final UIService aUIService

      public LoginViewController()

  • Method Details

    • onSignInButtonClick

      private void onSignInButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent pEvent)
      Handles the click event for the "Sign In" button. Authenticates the user based on the entered username and password. If the credentials match a manager account, the manager's dashboard is opened. Otherwise, the main dashboard is shown. Closes the login window after successful navigation.
      Parameters:
      pEvent - the action event triggered by clicking the "Sign In" button

    • onNewAccountButtonClick

      private void onNewAccountButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent pEvent)
      Handles the click event for the "New Account" button. Opens the "New Account" window by loading the corresponding FXML file and displays it in a new stage. Closes the current login window after successfully opening the "New Account" window.
      Parameters:
      pEvent - the action event triggered by clicking the "New Account" button
